member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Core.IMessageReceiver.RenewLockAsync(Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message)
member.summary: Renews the lock on the message. The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the queue.
member.remarks: When a message is received in mode, the message is locked on the server for this receiver instance for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation (LockDuration). If processing of the message requires longer than this duration, the lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the message is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Core.IMessageReceiver.PeekAsync
member.summary: Fetches the next active message without changing the state of the receiver or the message source.
member.remarks: The first call to fetches the first active message for this receiver. Each subsequent call fetches the subsequent message in the entity. Unlike a received messaged, peeked message will not have lock token associated with it, and hence it cannot be Completed/Abandoned/Deferred/Deadlettered/Renewed. Also, unlike , this method will fetch even Deferred messages (but not Deadlettered message)
member.returns: The that represents the next message to be read. Returns null when nothing to peek.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Core.IReceiverClient.PrefetchCount
member.summary: Prefetch speeds up the message flow by aiming to have a message readily available for local retrieval when and before the application asks for one using Receive. Setting a non-zero value prefetches PrefetchCount number of messages. Setting the value to zero turns prefetch off. Defaults to 0.

remarks.para: When Prefetch is enabled, the receiver will quietly acquire more messages, up to the PrefetchCount limit, than what the application immediately asks for. A single initial Receive/ReceiveAsync call will therefore acquire a message for immediate consumption that will be returned as soon as available, and the client will proceed to acquire further messages to fill the prefetch buffer in the background.

While messages are available in the prefetch buffer, any subsequent ReceiveAsync calls will be immediately satisfied from the buffer, and the buffer is replenished in the background as space becomes available.If there are no messages available for delivery, the receive operation will drain the buffer and then wait or block as expected.
Updates to this value take effect on the next receive call to the service.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.CorrelationFilter
member.summary: Represents the correlation filter expression.

remarks.para: A CorrelationFilter holds a set of conditions that are matched against one of more of an arriving message's user and system properties. A common use is a match against the property, but the application can also choose to match against , , , , , , , and any user-defined properties. A match exists when an arriving message's value for a property is equal to the value specified in the correlation filter. For string expressions, the comparison is case-sensitive. When specifying multiple match properties, the filter combines them as a logical AND condition, meaning all conditions must match for the filter to match.

The CorrelationFilter provides an efficient shortcut for declarations of filters that deal only with correlation equality. In this case the cost of the lexigraphical analysis of the expression can be avoided. Not only will correlation filters be optimized at declaration time, but they will also be optimized at runtime. Correlation filter matching can be reduced to a hashtable lookup, which aggregates the complexity of the set of defined correlation filters to O(1).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.IMessageSession
member.summary: Describes a Session object. IMessageSession can be used to perform operations on sessions.

remarks.para: Service Bus Sessions, also called 'Groups' in the AMQP 1.0 protocol, are unbounded sequences of related messages. ServiceBus guarantees ordering of messages in a session.

Any sender can create a session when submitting messages into a Topic or Queue by setting the property on Message to some application defined unique identifier. At the AMQP 1.0 protocol level, this value maps to the group-id property.

Sessions come into existence when there is at least one message with the session's SessionId in the Queue or Topic subscription. Once a Session exists, there is no defined moment or gesture for when the session expires or disappears.

member.returns: The session state as byte array.

member.summary: Set a custom state on the session which can be later retrieved using
member.param: A byte array of session state
member.remarks: This state is stored on Service Bus forever unless you set an empty state on it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.IMessageSession.RenewSessionLockAsync
member.summary: Renews the lock on the session specified by the . The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the entity.

remarks.para: When you accept a session, the session is locked for this client instance by the service for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation. If processing of the session requires longer than this duration, the session-lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the session is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.
Renewal of session renews all the messages in the session as well. Each individual message need not be renewed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.ISubscriptionClient.AddRuleAsync(System.String,Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Filter)
member.summary: Adds a rule to the current subscription to filter the messages reaching from topic to the subscription.
member.param: The filter expression against which messages will be matched.
member.returns: A task instance that represents the asynchronous add rule operation.
member.remarks: You can add rules to the subscription that will decide filter which messages from the topic should reach the subscription. A default rule named is always added while creation of the Subscription. You can add multiple rules with distinct names to the same subscription. Multiple filters combine with each other using logical OR condition. i.e., If any filter succeeds, the message is passed on to the subscription.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription
member.summary: Represents the metadata description of the queue.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of QueueDescription class with the specified relative path.
member.param: Path of the queue relative to the namespace base address.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.Path
member.summary: Path of the queue relative to the namespace base address.
member.remarks: Max length is 260 chars. Cannot start or end with a slash. Cannot have restricted characters: '@','?','#','*'

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.LockDuration
member.summary: Duration of a peek lock receive. i.e., the amount of time that the message is locked by a given receiver so that no other receiver receives the same message.
member.remarks: Max value is 5 minutes. Default value is 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.MaxSizeInMB
member.summary: The maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue.
member.remarks: Default value is 1024.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.RequiresDuplicateDetection
member.summary: This value indicates if the queue requires guard against duplicate messages. If true, duplicate messages having same and sent to queue within duration of will be discarded.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.RequiresSession
member.summary: This indicates whether the queue supports the concept of session. Sessionful-messages follow FIFO ordering.
member.remarks: If true, the receiver can only recieve messages using . Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.DefaultMessageTimeToLive
member.summary: The default time to live value for the messages. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus.
member.remarks: This is the default value used when is not set on a message itself. Messages older than their TimeToLive value will expire and no longer be retained in the message store. Subscribers will be unable to receive expired messages. Default value is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.AutoDeleteOnIdle
member.summary: The idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted.
member.remarks: The minimum duration is 5 minutes. Default value is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.EnableDeadLetteringOnMessageExpiration
member.summary: Indicates whether this queue has dead letter support when a message expires.
member.remarks: If true, the expired messages are moved to dead-letter sub-queue. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.DuplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow
member.summary: The duration of duplicate detection history that is maintained by the service.
member.remarks: The default value is 1 minute. Max value is 1 day and minimum is 20 seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.MaxDeliveryCount
member.summary: The maximum delivery count of a message before it is dead-lettered.
member.remarks: The delivery count is increased when a message is received in mode and didn't complete the message before the message lock expired. Default value is 10. Minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.EnableBatchedOperations
member.summary: Indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
member.remarks: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.AuthorizationRules
member.summary: The on the queue to control user access at entity level.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.Status
member.summary: The current status of the queue (Enabled / Disabled).
member.remarks: When an entity is disabled, that entity cannot send or receive messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.ForwardTo
member.summary: The path of the recipient entity to which all the messages sent to the queue are forwarded to.
member.remarks: If set, user cannot manually receive messages from this queue. The destination entity must be an already existing entity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.ForwardDeadLetteredMessagesTo
member.summary: The path of the recipient entity to which all the dead-lettered messages of this queue are forwarded to.
member.remarks: If set, user cannot manually receive dead-lettered messages from this queue. The destination entity must already exist.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.EnablePartitioning
member.summary: Indicates whether the queue is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.QueueDescription.UserMetadata
member.summary: Custom metdata that user can associate with the description.
member.remarks: Cannot be null. Max length is 1024 chars.

member.summary: List of properties that were retrieved using GetQueue but are not understood by this version of client is stored here. The list will be sent back when an already retrieved QueueDescription will be used in UpdateQueue call.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.AutoDeleteOnIdle
member.summary: The idle interval after which the topic is automatically deleted.
member.remarks: The minimum duration is 5 minutes. Default value is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.MaxSizeInMB
member.summary: The maximum size of the topic in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the topic.
member.remarks: Default value is 1024.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.RequiresDuplicateDetection
member.summary: This value indicates if the topic requires guard against duplicate messages. If true, duplicate messages having same and sent to topic within duration of will be discarded.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.DuplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow
member.summary: The duration of duplicate detection history that is maintained by the service.
member.remarks: The default value is 1 minute. Max value is 1 day and minimum is 20 seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.Path
member.summary: Path of the topic relative to the namespace base address.
member.remarks: Max length is 260 chars. Cannot start or end with a slash. Cannot have restricted characters: '@','?','#','*'

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.AuthorizationRules
member.summary: The on the topic to control user access at entity level.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.Status
member.summary: The current status of the topic (Enabled / Disabled).
member.remarks: When an entity is disabled, that entity cannot send or receive messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.EnablePartitioning
member.summary: Indicates whether the topic is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.SupportOrdering
member.summary: Defines whether ordering needs to be maintained. If true, messages sent to topic will be forwarded to the subscription in order.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.EnableBatchedOperations
member.summary: Indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
member.remarks: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.UserMetadata
member.summary: Custom metdata that user can associate with the description.
member.remarks: Cannot be null. Max length is 1024 chars.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Management.TopicDescription.UnknownProperties
member.summary: List of properties that were retrieved using GetTopic but are not understood by this version of client is stored here. The list will be sent back when an already retrieved TopicDescription will be used in UpdateTopic call.

member.summary: User property key representing detailed error description, when a message is received from a deadletter subqueue of an entity.

member.summary: Creates a new Message

member.summary: Creates a new message from the specified payload.
member.param: The payload of the message in bytes

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the body of the message.
member.remarks:
The easiest way to create a new message from a string is the following:
message.Body = System.Text.Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes("Message1");

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets the MessageId to identify the message.
member.remarks: The message identifier is an application-defined value that uniquely identifies the message and its payload. The identifier is a free-form string and can reflect a GUID or an identifier derived from the application context. If enabled, the duplicate detection feature identifies and removes second and further submissions of messages with the same MessageId.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.PartitionKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a partition key for sending a message to a partitioned entity.
member.value: The partition key. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: For partitioned entities, setting this value enables assigning related messages to the same internal partition, so that submission sequence order is correctly recorded. The partition is chosen by a hash function over this value and cannot be chosen directly. For session-aware entities, the property overrides this value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.ViaPartitionKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a partition key for sending a message into an entity via a partitioned transfer queue.
member.value: The partition key. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: If a message is sent via a transfer queue in the scope of a transaction, this value selects the transfer queue partition: This is functionally equivalent to and ensures that messages are kept together and in order as they are transferred. See Transfers and Send Via.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SessionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the session identifier for a session-aware entity.
member.value: The session identifier. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: For session-aware entities, this application-defined value specifies the session affiliation of the message. Messages with the same session identifier are subject to summary locking and enable exact in-order processing and demultiplexing. For session-unaware entities, this value is ignored. See Message Sessions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.ReplyToSessionId
member.summary: Gets or sets a session identifier augmenting the address.
member.value: Session identifier. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: This value augments the ReplyTo information and specifies which SessionId should be set for the reply when sent to the reply entity. See Message Routing and Correlation

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.ExpiresAtUtc
member.summary: Gets the date and time in UTC at which the message is set to expire.
member.value: The message expiration time in UTC. This property is read-only.
member.exception: If the message has not been received. For example if a new message was created but not yet sent and received.
member.remarks: The UTC instant at which the message is marked for removal and no longer available for retrieval from the entity due to expiration. Expiry is controlled by the property and this property is computed from +

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.TimeToLive
member.summary: Gets or sets the messages "time to live" value.
member.value: The messages time to live value.
member.remarks: This value is the relative duration after which the message expires, starting from the instant the message has been accepted and stored by the broker, as captured in . When not set explicitly, the assumed value is the DefaultTimeToLive for the respective queue or topic. A message-level value cannot be longer than the entity's DefaultTimeToLive setting and it is silently adjusted if it does. See Expiration

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.CorrelationId
member.summary: Gets or sets the a correlation identifier.
member.value: Correlation identifier.
member.remarks: Allows an application to specify a context for the message for the purposes of correlation, for example reflecting the MessageId of a message that is being replied to. See Message Routing and Correlation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets an application specific label.
member.value: The application specific label
member.remarks: This property enables the application to indicate the purpose of the message to the receiver in a standardized fashion, similar to an email subject line. The mapped AMQP property is "subject".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.To
member.summary: Gets or sets the "to" address.
member.value: The "to" address.
member.remarks: This property is reserved for future use in routing scenarios and presently ignored by the broker itself. Applications can use this value in rule-driven auto-forward chaining scenarios to indicate the intended logical destination of the message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the content type descriptor.
member.value: RFC2045 Content-Type descriptor.
member.remarks: Optionally describes the payload of the message, with a descriptor following the format of RFC2045, Section 5, for example "application/json".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.ReplyTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of an entity to send replies to.
member.value: The reply entity address.
member.remarks: This optional and application-defined value is a standard way to express a reply path to the receiver of the message. When a sender expects a reply, it sets the value to the absolute or relative path of the queue or topic it expects the reply to be sent to. See Message Routing and Correlation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.ScheduledEnqueueTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time in UTC at which the message will be enqueued. This property returns the time in UTC; when setting the property, the supplied DateTime value must also be in UTC.
member.value: The scheduled enqueue time in UTC. This value is for delayed message sending. It is utilized to delay messages sending to a specific time in the future.
member.remarks: Message enqueuing time does not mean that the message will be sent at the same time. It will get enqueued, but the actual sending time depends on the queue's workload and its state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.Size
member.summary: Gets the total size of the message body in bytes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.UserProperties
member.summary: Gets the "user properties" bag, which can be used for custom message metadata.
member.remarks: Only following value types are supported: byte, sbyte, char, short, ushort, int, uint, long, ulong, float, double, decimal, bool, Guid, string, Uri, DateTime, DateTimeOffset, TimeSpan

member.returns: The string representation of the current message.

member.summary: Clones a message, so that it is possible to send a clone of an already received message as a new message. The system properties of original message are not copied.
member.returns: A cloned .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection
member.summary: A collection used to store properties which are set by the Service Bus service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.IsLockTokenSet
member.summary: Specifies whether or not there is a lock token set on the current message.
member.remarks: A lock token will only be specified if the message was received using

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.LockToken
member.summary: Gets the lock token for the current message.
member.remarks: The lock token is a reference to the lock that is being held by the broker in mode. Locks are used to explicitly settle messages as explained in the product documentation in more detail. The token can also be used to pin the lock permanently through the Deferral API and, with that, take the message out of the regular delivery state flow. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.IsReceived
member.summary: Specifies if the message has been obtained from the broker.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.DeliveryCount
member.summary: Get the current delivery count.
member.value: This value starts at 1.
member.remarks: Number of deliveries that have been attempted for this message. The count is incremented when a message lock expires, or the message is explicitly abandoned by the receiver. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.LockedUntilUtc
member.summary: Gets the date and time in UTC until which the message will be locked in the queue/subscription.
member.value: The date and time until which the message will be locked in the queue/subscription.
member.remarks: For messages retrieved under a lock (peek-lock receive mode, not pre-settled) this property reflects the UTC instant until which the message is held locked in the queue/subscription. When the lock expires, the is incremented and the message is again available for retrieval. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.SequenceNumber
member.summary: Gets the unique number assigned to a message by Service Bus.
member.remarks: The sequence number is a unique 64-bit integer assigned to a message as it is accepted and stored by the broker and functions as its true identifier. For partitioned entities, the topmost 16 bits reflect the partition identifier. Sequence numbers monotonically increase. They roll over to 0 when the 48-64 bit range is exhausted. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.DeadLetterSource
member.summary: Gets the name of the queue or subscription that this message was enqueued on, before it was deadlettered.
member.remarks: Only set in messages that have been dead-lettered and subsequently auto-forwarded from the dead-letter queue to another entity. Indicates the entity in which the message was dead-lettered. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.EnqueuedSequenceNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the original sequence number of the message.
member.value: The enqueued sequence number of the message.
member.remarks: For messages that have been auto-forwarded, this property reflects the sequence number that had first been assigned to the message at its original point of submission. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message.SystemPropertiesCollection.EnqueuedTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time of the sent time in UTC.
member.value: The enqueue time in UTC.
member.remarks: The UTC instant at which the message has been accepted and stored in the entity. This value can be used as an authoritative and neutral arrival time indicator when the receiver does not want to trust the sender's clock. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.QueueClient.PrefetchCount
member.summary: Prefetch speeds up the message flow by aiming to have a message readily available for local retrieval when and before the application asks for one using Receive. Setting a non-zero value prefetches PrefetchCount number of messages. Setting the value to zero turns prefetch off. Defaults to 0.

remarks.para: When Prefetch is enabled, the client will quietly acquire more messages, up to the PrefetchCount limit, than what the application immediately asks for. The message pump will therefore acquire a message for immediate consumption that will be returned as soon as available, and the client will proceed to acquire further messages to fill the prefetch buffer in the background.

While messages are available in the prefetch buffer, any subsequent ReceiveAsync calls will be immediately satisfied from the buffer, and the buffer is replenished in the background as space becomes available.If there are no messages available for delivery, the receive operation will drain the buffer and then wait or block as expected.
Updates to this value take effect on the next receive call to the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.SubscriptionClient.PrefetchCount
member.summary: Prefetch speeds up the message flow by aiming to have a message readily available for local retrieval when and before the application asks for one using Receive. Setting a non-zero value prefetches PrefetchCount number of messages. Setting the value to zero turns prefetch off. Defaults to 0.

remarks.para: When Prefetch is enabled, the client will quietly acquire more messages, up to the PrefetchCount limit, than what the application immediately asks for. The message pump will therefore acquire a message for immediate consumption that will be returned as soon as available, and the client will proceed to acquire further messages to fill the prefetch buffer in the background.

While messages are available in the prefetch buffer, any subsequent ReceiveAsync calls will be immediately satisfied from the buffer, and the buffer is replenished in the background as space becomes available.If there are no messages available for delivery, the receive operation will drain the buffer and then wait or block as expected.
Updates to this value take effect on the next receive call to the service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.SubscriptionClient.AddRuleAsync(System.String,Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Filter)
member.summary: Adds a rule to the current subscription to filter the messages reaching from topic to the subscription.
member.param: The filter expression against which messages will be matched.
member.returns: A task instance that represents the asynchronous add rule operation.
member.remarks: You can add rules to the subscription that decides which messages from the topic should reach the subscription. A default rule named is always added while creation of the Subscription. You can add multiple rules with distinct names to the same subscription. Multiple filters combine with each other using logical OR condition. i.e., If any filter succeeds, the message is passed on to the subscription. Max allowed length of rule name is 50 chars.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.TransportType.Amqp
member.summary: Uses AMQP over TCP. This is the default value. It runs on port 5671.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.TransportType.AmqpWebSockets
member.summary: Uses AMQP over WebSockets
member.remarks: This runs on port 443 with wss URI scheme. This could be used in scenarios where traffic to port 5671 is blocked. To setup a proxy connection, please configure system default proxy. Proxy currently is supported only in .NET 4.5.1 and higher or .NET Core 2.1 and higher.
